posts.post_content:
hands down the best creature in magic for the first 6 or 8 years. I mean, is it even close?  
still very playable today  
![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) is easy to get on the first or second turn in a vintage deck, and his drawback isnt really much  
lots of people have suggested lots of creatures that they consider to be better then Juzam, most of those creatures seem like much worse choices to me. The only 2 that were interesting enough to me to go out and buy were [Plague Sliver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plague Sliver) and [Phyrexian Obliterator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Obliterator).   
The Sliver is nice, except that having 2 or 3 of him on the table is a problem, rather then super exciting like it is with Juzam. The 'bonus' of having the Sliver hose Sliver decks is marginal in my eyes. In the 20 years ive been playing magic MAYBE half of 1% of the games Ive played have been against Sliver decks. Even still I stuck 1 of them in my deck and kind of consider him my 5th Juzam. (yes like the 5th beatle)  
The Obliterator is an awesome looking ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

The Sliver is nice, except that having 2 or 3 of him on the table is a problem, rather then super exciting like it is with Juzam.
